result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeannie M. Balber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation no contact with JAB dob 3-6-05 and WB dob 9-10-09 unless approved by DOC.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. Court costs and fine totaling $654.00. Credit for 1 day of time served in jail. Bond of $750 to be forwarded to DOC.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

in support of motion for bail modification
for bail modification
As per request of Attorney Gramstrup, reset MH (for bond modification) from 12/10/15 out to 12/15/15.
Motion hearing at 12-15-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Jeannie M. Balber in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup via phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gramstrup waives prelim.  Court advised the defendant as to her right to a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived her right to a prelim and finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Defendant requests bail modification - Atty Gramstrup makes stmt will be filing a motion - Court bail will continue at this time  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeannie M. Balber in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup appeared by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeannie Balber in court with Attorney Chris Gramstrup.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State.    LCO ICW, Ms. Allensworth requests modification of bond to allow contact between Mother and Child J.B. for family counseling.   DA strongly objects.   Issue is tabled until mental health professional has reviewed matter and presented to the court that the family counseling is merited.
Defendant Jeannie Balber in court with Attorney Chris Gramstrup.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State.   Bond Continues.
No Contact directly or indirectly with minor child J.B.
